title: Antigravity: 403 verify-account auto OAuth + 30min cooldown
description:
Acceptance Criteria:
- Antigravity/Gemini upstream 403 containing verify/validation_required/accounts.google.com/signin/continue triggers interactive OAuth (Camoufox) exactly once per alias/token within cooldown.
- Subsequent requests within 30 minutes do NOT re-open OAuth; error is returned but without repeated auth attempts.
- Portal readiness wait uses 300s default (configurable).
- Add logs/metrics to confirm when repair is skipped due to cooldown.
notes:
Started implementation: improve 403 status extraction + Camoufox auto repair env + 30min cooldown guard. Pending full build:dev + install:global verification.
Evidence
- 403 status extraction now checks nested response.status/response.statusCode: src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts
- 403 verify/validation_required triggers interactive OAuth via Camoufox with cooldown guard: src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts + src/providers/auth/oauth-repair-cooldown.ts
- Camoufox auto mode wired for antigravity/qwen/gemini in auto repair: src/providers/auth/oauth-repair-env.ts

Tests
- npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.google-verify.spec.ts tests/providers/auth/oauth-repair-cooldown.spec.ts â†’ PASS

Verification
- npm run build:dev â†’ OK (includes install:global; routecodex --version = 0.89.1685)
close_reason: Antigravity 403 verify-account auto OAuth + cooldown; verified

title: Routing: antigravity gemini-3-pro-low maxContext=256k + longcontext backup
description:
## Context
- antigravity provider config currently declares gemini-3-pro-low maxContext=1,000,000 and routes it as longcontext primary.
- Actual gemini-3-pro-low context is 256k; when token estimates exceed 256k this should not be a primary longcontext target.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Update config so antigravity gemini-3-pro-low maxContext=256000 (and used by VirtualRouter).
- Move antigravity.gemini-3-pro-low from longcontext primary pool to longcontext backup pool.
- Update provider default catalog so newly-inited configs carry the same maxContext for gemini-3-pro-low.
- Verify `npm run build:dev` and `npm run install:global`.
notes:
Implemented config+catalog updates for gemini-3-pro-low context/routing; running full build verification next.
Evidence:
- Updated local config: ~/.routecodex/config.json
  - virtualrouter.providers.antigravity.models.gemini-3-pro-low.maxContext = 256000
  - virtualrouter.routing.longcontext: removed antigravity.gemini-3-pro-low from longcontext-gemini-primary; added to longcontext-backup
- Updated default init catalog: src/cli/config/init-provider-catalog.ts (gemini-3-pro-low maxContext=256000)
- Verified: npm run build:dev (includes npm run install:global) succeeded (v0.89.1699)
close_reason: Set gemini-3-pro-low maxContext=256k and moved it to longcontext backup.

title: CLI oauth: surface quota authIssue (verify required) to match daemon-admin
description:
## Context
- daemon-admin Credentials shows token validity plus quota authIssue (e.g. google_account_verification => "verify required").
- CLI `routecodex oauth <selector>` may print "Token is still valid; skip interactive" or "è®¤è¯å®Œæˆ" without surfacing that the alias is quarantined (reason=authVerify) and still needs Google account verification.
- Users perceive CLI vs WebUI as conflicting.

## Acceptance Criteria
- When a token is valid but quota-manager indicates google_account_verification for the same provider+alias, CLI prints a clear warning and the verification URL hint.
- When OAuth refresh/reauth completes, CLI prints the same warning if verify-required remains flagged.
- Add unit test coverage for the warning logic.
- `npm run build:dev` + `npm run install:global` pass.
notes:
Implemented CLI warning for quota-manager google_account_verification (verify required) so CLI and daemon-admin no longer conflict.

Evidence
- Reads ~/.routecodex/quota/quota-manager.json and detects authIssue.kind=google_account_verification: src/token-daemon/quota-auth-issue.ts
- routecodex oauth <selector> now warns even when token is valid/skip OAuth, and after successful reauth: src/token-daemon/index.ts
- Tests: tests/token-daemon/interactive-refresh.spec.ts (added coverage)

Verification
- npm run build:dev (includes npm run install:global) PASS (RouteCodex v0.89.1701)
close_reason: CLI oauth surfaces verify-required quota authIssue

title: bug(quota-ui): reset action doesn't clear antigravity alias + remove health sorting
description:
## Context
- daemon-admin Quota table sorts by health (inPool/cooldown/blacklist) on every poll, which makes rows jump and selection unstable.
- WebUI reset on an antigravity providerKey may not clear alias-level quarantine/blacklist across models; expected one reset to recover the whole alias.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Quota table ordering is stable across polling (sort by providerKey only; no health-based reordering).
- POST /quota/providers/:providerKey/reset and /recover reset/recover the whole antigravity alias group (all providerKeys under antigravity.<alias>.*).
- Verified by npm run build:dev (includes install:global).
notes:
Fixes daemon-admin quota UX + reset semantics.

Evidence
- Quota table no longer health-sorts on every poll (stable providerKey sort): docs/daemon-admin-ui.html
- Reset/Recover for antigravity now expands to whole alias group (antigravity.<alias>.*) using quota admin snapshot: src/server/runtime/http-server/daemon-admin/quota-handler.ts

Verification
- npm run build:dev (includes npm run install:global) PASS (RouteCodex v0.89.1701)
close_reason: Stable quota UI ordering + alias-group reset/recover

title: feat(oauth): CLI auto-open google verify URL in Camoufox
description:
## Context
- CLI `routecodex oauth <selector>` may report success/valid token while quota-manager still marks the alias as `google_account_verification` (verify required).
- Today CLI prints the verification URL, but user must manually copy/paste or switch to daemon-admin UI to click open.

## Acceptance Criteria
- When CLI detects verify-required and URL is present, it can open the verification URL in Camoufox automatically in headed mode (open-only, no callback wait).
- Default behavior: prompt the user to open (TTY). If `--headful` is used or env `ROUTECODEX_OAUTH_AUTO_OPEN_VERIFY=1`, auto-open without prompt.
- URL is sanitized (strip newlines / trailing text; extract first https URL).
- Unit tests cover auto-open path.
- `npm run build:dev` + `npm run install:global` pass.
notes:
Evidence (2026-02-05)
- Auto-open verify URL (Camoufox open-only): src/token-daemon/index.ts
- Sanitize quota-manager authIssue.url (strip newlines/trailing text): src/token-daemon/quota-auth-issue.ts
- Unit test: tests/token-daemon/interactive-refresh.spec.ts (auto open when ROUTECODEX_CAMOUFOX_DEV_MODE=1 / --headful)

Verification
- npm test (PASS)
- npm run build:dev (PASS, includes install:global) â€” RouteCodex v0.89.1702
close_reason: CLI can open google verify URL in Camoufox (open-only) when quota-manager flags verify-required.

title: bug(token-daemon): refreshAhead default 30min + permanent refresh suppression
description:
## Context
- `docs/OAUTH.md` says token-daemon refreshes **30 minutes** before expiry and supports env override `ROUTECODEX_TOKEN_REFRESH_AHEAD_MIN`, but code default is 5 minutes and doesn't read that env var.
- Permanent refresh failures (e.g. qwen invalid refresh token/client_id) should persistently suppress further background refresh attempts without getting cleared by daemon's own token-file writes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- TokenDaemon default refreshAhead is 30 minutes.
- Env override works: `ROUTECODEX_TOKEN_REFRESH_AHEAD_MIN` / `RCC_TOKEN_REFRESH_AHEAD_MIN`.
- Permanent refresh failure writes `noRefresh` and history uses post-write mtime so auto-suspension isn't cleared immediately.
- Docs updated to reflect actual behavior (CLI auto-open verify URL + refreshAhead env).
- `npm run build:dev` passes (includes install:global).
notes:
Evidence (2026-02-05)
- TokenDaemon refreshAhead default=30 + env override: src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts
- Permanent refresh failure writes noRefresh + uses post-write mtime in history: src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts
- TokenHistoryStore paths now resolved per-instance (respects /Users/fanzhang in tests/edge env): src/token-daemon/history-store.ts
- Tests: tests/token-daemon/token-daemon.auto-refresh-noninteractive.spec.ts (noRefresh + mtime)
- Tests: tests/token-daemon/token-daemon.refresh-ahead.spec.ts (default + env override)
- Test suite list updated: package.json ()
- Docs: CLI verify-required now offers Camoufox one-step open + env flag: docs/OAUTH.md

Verification
- npm run build:dev PASS (RouteCodex v0.89.1705; includes install:global)
Note: package.json test:routing-instructions now includes tests/token-daemon/token-daemon.refresh-ahead.spec.ts (so build:dev runs it). TokenHistoryStore now resolves paths from process.env.HOME at runtime (so tests can sandbox state).

Added explicit mode handling to /daemon/oauth/authorize in src/server/runtime/http-server/daemon-admin/credentials-handler.ts: mode=manual clears ROUTECODEX_CAMOUFOX_AUTO_MODE/ROUTECODEX_OAUTH_AUTO_CONFIRM, mode=auto uses withOAuthRepairEnv; headful control split (manual default headed, auto headed only with debug flag). title: Fix Qwen OAuth userInfo endpoint + stable api_key
description:
## Context
Qwen OAuth login completes but token appears to not persist / keeps reauthing; logs show userInfo 404 and refresh failures.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Default Qwen userInfo endpoint no longer 404s in normal flows (switch to chat.qwen.ai and keep portal fallback).
- If userInfo returns a stable api_key (different from access_token), token file is written with `norefresh: true`.
- If api_key == access_token (fallback), treat it as non-stable and keep trying to enrich when possible.
- Unit tests cover enrich + fallback behaviors.
notes:
- Evidence:
  - `npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.qwen-enrich.spec.ts tests/providers/auth/tokenfile-auth.qwen-alias.spec.ts tests/server/http-server/apikey-secret-resolution.spec.ts tests/server/http-server/httpserver-apikey-env-resolution.spec.ts` (PASS)
  - `npm run install:global` builds + installs; `routecodex --version` prints 0.89.1669
- Changes:
  - Qwen userInfo default switched to `https://chat.qwen.ai/api/v1/user/info` with portal fallback: `src/providers/auth/qwen-userinfo-helper.ts`
  - Qwen tokens: mark `norefresh: true` when api_key is stable; treat api_key==access_token as non-stable: `src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts`, `src/providers/auth/qwen-userinfo-helper.ts`
  - OAuth config default userInfoUrl aligned: `src/providers/core/config/provider-oauth-configs.ts`
  - Tests updated/added: `tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.qwen-enrich.spec.ts`
close_reason: Qwen userInfo default uses chat.qwen.ai; stable api_key marked norefresh; enrich/fallback tests pass.

title: Allow startup with missing env apikeys (non-blocking provider init)
description:
## Context
When config uses env refs (e.g. `${CRS_API_KEY}`) but env var is missing, RouteCodex currently aborts server startup. This makes shareable repo configs hard to use unless all keys are present.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Server can start even if some providers fail to init due to missing env var (emit provider error events + keep running).
- Routing/request path fails over when a selected provider has no runtime handle.
- Local providers (e.g. LM Studio localhost) can keep `auth.apiKey: ""` without fake keys and without blocking startup.
notes:
- Evidence:
  - `routecodex start --config ~/.routecodex/config.json` now starts even with missing `${CRS_API_KEY}` etc; emits `[route-error] ... source=provider.provider.runtime.init` and continues.
  - `lmstudio` runtime initializes with `auth.apiKey: ""` (no fake key) when endpoint is `http://127.0.0.1:...`.
  - Tests: `npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/server/http-server/apikey-secret-resolution.spec.ts tests/cli/start-command.spec.ts tests/sharedmodule/virtual-router-routing-model-validation.spec.ts` (PASS).
- Implementation:
  - Non-blocking provider init + failover for missing runtimes: `src/server/runtime/http-server/index.ts`.
  - Local-noauth handling: `src/server/runtime/http-server/index.ts`, `src/providers/core/runtime/provider-factory.ts`, `src/providers/auth/apikey-auth.ts`.
  - Local baseURL empty apikey allowed in llmswitch-core bootstrap: `sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/src/router/virtual-router/bootstrap.ts`.
close_reason: Provider init no longer aborts startup on missing env apikey; local LM Studio accepts empty key; routing fails over when runtime missing.

title: TokenFileAuthProvider picks up token created after init
description:
## Problem
When OAuth token file is created *after* provider initialization (common when user completes device-code login after server starts), TokenFileAuthProvider may keep failing and server appears to "not take token" until restart.
acceptance_criteria:
- TokenFileAuthProvider can start with missing token file (status invalid) but later, after token file appears, buildHeaders succeeds without requiring restart/re-init.
- Unit test covers late token creation.
notes:
Fix:
- TokenFileAuthProvider now starts leniently (token file may be missing at init) and re-reads token from disk on each buildHeaders/validateCredentials, so tokens created after OAuth complete are picked up without restart.

Files:
- src/providers/auth/tokenfile-auth.ts
- tests/providers/auth/tokenfile-auth.qwen-alias.spec.ts

Evidence:

- npm run build:dev (PASS)
close_reason: TokenFileAuthProvider can pick up late-created token files

title: Antigravity 403 verify-account triggers interactive OAuth
description:
## Problem
Antigravity/Gemini upstream may return HTTP 403 with messages like "verify your account" / "validation_required" / "accounts.google.com/signin/continue". Today this does not trigger interactive OAuth repair, so requests fail without auto portal/browser flow.
acceptance_criteria:
- When upstream error is 403 and message contains verify-account/validation_required/accounts.google.com/signin/continue (or support.google.com/accounts?p=al_alert), provider triggers interactive OAuth repair (openBrowser=true) via oauth-lifecycle.
- Unit test covers classification.
notes:
Fix:
- Treat Antigravity/Gemini HTTP 403 verify-account / validation_required / accounts.google.com/signin/continue as an interactive OAuth repair trigger (openBrowser flow).

Files:
- src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts
- tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle-antigravity-verify-account.spec.ts

Evidence:
- npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle-antigravity-verify-account.spec.ts (PASS)
- npm run build:dev (PASS)
close_reason: 403 verify-account now triggers interactive OAuth repair

title: Qwen oauth command should not force reauth when token valid
description:
## Problem
`routecodex oauth <tokenFile>` currently always runs interactive OAuth with `forceReauthorize=true`, so even after a successful authorization it keeps asking the user to authenticate again, causing a perceived "infinite auth loop".

Additionally, when user config has no qwen provider, the token file will never be used, which increases confusion.
acceptance_criteria:
- `routecodex oauth <selector>` skips opening browser when the token state is valid and not near expiry, unless `--force` is provided.
- When token is expiring/expired/invalid, it attempts non-forced refresh first and only falls back to interactive flow when needed.
- For qwen tokens, prints a clear warning if loaded user config has no qwen provider entry.
notes:
Fix:
- `routecodex oauth <selector>` no longer forces interactive reauth every time. It skips when token is valid, and only does forced reauth when `--force` is used.
- Explicit reauth commands (token-daemon refresh, oauth *-auto, reauth-required) keep forcing reauth.
- For qwen token, warns when user config has no qwen provider entry (token would never be used).

Files:
- src/token-daemon/index.ts
- src/commands/oauth.ts
- src/commands/token-daemon.ts
- tests/token-daemon/interactive-refresh.spec.ts
- scripts/tests/ci-jest.mjs
- package.json

Evidence:
- npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/token-daemon/interactive-refresh.spec.ts (PASS)
- npm run build:dev (PASS)
close_reason: OAuth command no longer forces reauth when token valid

title: Qwen Camoufox auto: click confirm on authorize page
description:
## Goal
Add a `qwen-auto` OAuth helper similar to `gemini-auto`/`antigravity-auto`, using Camoufox automation to click Qwen's authorize confirmation button after portal redirect.

## Context
Qwen authorize page shows a Confirm button like: `button.qwen-confirm-btn` (span text: Confirm).

## Acceptance Criteria
- New CLI command: `routecodex oauth qwen-auto <selector>` runs Camoufox in auto mode `qwen` (headless by default) and performs the confirm click.
- `scripts/camoufox/launch-auth.mjs` supports `--auto-mode qwen` and clicks `button.qwen-confirm-btn` when present.
- `npm run build:dev` passes (includes global install).
notes:
Implemented Qwen auto confirm click.

Changes:
- src/commands/oauth.ts: add `qwen-auto` command (Camoufox automation mode=qwen)
- scripts/camoufox/launch-auth.mjs: support auto-mode qwen, click `button.qwen-confirm-btn`

Evidence:
- npm run build:dev (PASS, includes install:global)

Usage:
- routecodex oauth qwen-auto qwen-oauth-1-default.json
close_reason: qwen-auto added; camoufox clicks confirm button

title: Qwen qwen-auto: wait for confirm settle + fix manual fallback (no localhost callback)
description:
## Problem
Qwen uses a device-code style authorize page (e.g. https://chat.qwen.ai/authorize?user_code=...), not a localhost OAuth callback.

Current `qwen-auto` clicks `button.qwen-confirm-btn` but closes shortly after, and the auto fallback path (headed manual assist) waits for a localhost callback that will never happen for Qwen.

## Acceptance Criteria
- After clicking `button.qwen-confirm-btn`, qwen-auto waits for a reasonable "settled" signal (URL change, button disappearance, or success UI) before closing the browser.
- If auto selector matching fails and we fall back to headed mode, Qwen fallback does NOT wait for a localhost callback; it should instead keep the browser open for manual completion and exit when the user closes it or after a timeout.
- Add a small unit test ensuring `qwen-auto` subcommand is registered under `oauth`.
- `npm run build:dev` passes.
notes:
Fix:
- TokenDaemon background refresh no longer opens interactive OAuth (prevents Qwen auth popups during build/install).
- qwen-auto automation waits for confirm to settle and has a Qwen-specific headed fallback that does not wait for localhost callback.
- Added unit tests and included them in routing/CI test lists.

Files:
- src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts
- scripts/camoufox/launch-auth.mjs
- tests/token-daemon/token-daemon.auto-refresh-noninteractive.spec.ts
- tests/commands/oauth-command.qwen-auto.spec.ts
- package.json
- scripts/tests/ci-jest.mjs

Evidence:
- npm run build:dev (PASS, includes install:global)
close_reason: Stop qwen auth popups during build; harden qwen-auto

title: fix(qwen): invalid refresh token should not spam/block
description:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Have a Qwen OAuth token file where refresh_token is invalid (revoked/expired) or client_id mismatch.
2. Start server (TokenDaemon enabled) or wait for TokenDaemon tick.
3. Observe repeated logs like: OAuth error: invalid_request - Invalid refresh token or client_id.

## Expected
- Auto-refresh should fail fast on permanent refresh errors and stop retrying/spamming until token file changes.
- Non-Qwen traffic should not be impacted by Qwen refresh failures.

## Actual
- Refresh retries multiple times and keeps trying periodically, producing noisy logs and perceived blocking.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Abort OAuth refresh retry loop early on permanent refresh errors (invalid_request/invalid_grant/invalid_client related to refresh token/client_id).
- TokenDaemon auto-suspends token immediately on permanent refresh failure until token file mtime changes.
- Add/adjust unit tests covering this behavior.
- Run verification: npm run verify:repo-sanity + targeted jest.
notes:
Evidence
- Early abort for permanent refresh errors: src/providers/core/strategies/oauth-device-flow.ts, src/providers/core/strategies/oauth-auth-code-flow.ts, src/providers/core/strategies/oauth-refresh-errors.ts
- TokenDaemon now classifies permanent refresh failure and immediately auto-suspends the token until token file mtime changes: src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts, src/token-daemon/history-store.ts

Tests
- npm run verify:repo-sanity  â†’ [repo-sanity] ok
- npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/token-daemon/history-store.auto-suspend-immediate.spec.ts tests/providers/core/oauth-refresh-permanent-errors.spec.ts  â†’ PASS
close_reason: Stop repeated Qwen refresh retries on permanent errors; auto-suspend until token changes; verified by tests

title: bug(antigravity): 403 reauth should use camoufox auto + increase portal wait
description:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Antigravity upstream returns HTTP 403 with keywords like: "verify your account" / "validation_required" / "accounts.google.com/signin/continue".
2. RouteCodex detects it and triggers interactive OAuth repair.
3. Observe it does not use existing Camoufox auto flow, and portal readiness wait is too short under slow networks.

## Expected
- Interactive OAuth repair for Antigravity uses Camoufox auto flow (same as `routecodex oauth antigravity-auto ...`).
- Portal readiness wait is sufficiently long (300s) to tolerate slow startup/latency before opening browser.

## Actual
- Repair opens without auto-mode, and portal readiness check can time out quickly.

## Acceptance Criteria
- When `handleUpstreamInvalidOAuthToken()` triggers for provider `antigravity`, it sets Camoufox auto mode to `antigravity` for the duration of the repair call.
- OAuth portal readiness check timeout increases to 300 seconds (configurable via env), instead of ~3 seconds.
- Add unit test(s) for the new portal wait configuration and/or the env-scoped auto-mode behaviour.
- Run verification: `npm run verify:repo-sanity` + targeted jest (and ideally `npm run build:dev` + `npm run install:global`).

title: Qwen OAuth: stop reauth loop; add qwen-auto confirm click
description:
Acceptance Criteria:
- Server startup/build does not trigger interactive Qwen OAuth popups by default.
- On real request: attempt silent refresh; if refresh fails/invalid, trigger interactive OAuth flow and successfully writes token file.
- Qwen portal auto flow clicks Confirm button after portal redirect (Camoufox automation).
- Document: how to refresh vs reauth Qwen.
notes:
Started implementation: qwen auto confirm via Camoufox auto mode; reduce noisy refresh logs; skip token-daemon refresh for unconfigured providers. Pending full build:dev + install:global verification.
Evidence
- Auto repair env uses Camoufox + qwen auto mode: src/providers/auth/oauth-repair-env.ts
- Manual `routecodex oauth qwen-oauth-1-default.json` defaults to qwen Camoufox auto mode (Confirm button): src/token-daemon/index.ts
- Background token refresh skips unconfigured providers (override: ROUTECODEX_TOKEN_DAEMON_REFRESH_UNCONFIGURED=1): src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts
- Per-attempt refresh failures moved to debug logging to reduce noise: src/providers/core/strategies/oauth-device-flow.ts

Docs
- Updated docs/OAUTH.md with qwen auto default note + 403 cooldown + portal ready timeout envs

Verification
- npm run build:dev OK (includes install:global; routecodex --version = 0.89.1685)
close_reason: Qwen OAuth loop mitigations + qwen auto confirm wiring; verified

title: bug(oauth): interactive reauth must not block requests
description:
## Problem\nWhen upstream triggers interactive OAuth (e.g. antigravity 403 verify account), the provider layer blocks the in-flight request waiting up to 10 minutes for localhost callback. This prevents Virtual Router failover and breaks streaming sessions.\n\n## Acceptance Criteria\n- In provider request path, interactive OAuth reauth never blocks the current request.\n- Attempt silent refresh first; if still invalid or google verify required, start interactive OAuth in background (Camoufox auto env) with cooldown guard.\n- Request returns promptly so Virtual Router can failover.\n- Add unit tests for non-blocking behavior.\n- Verify with 
> routecodex@0.89.1686 build:dev
> bash -lc 'export BUILD_MODE=dev; npm run build && npm run test:unified-hub-shadow && npm run verify:e2e-toolcall && npm run verify:apply-patch && npm run verify:apply-patch-regressions && npm run verify:exec-command && npm run test:routing-instructions && npm run test:cli && npm run install:global && npm run mock:regressions && npm run test:blackbox-antigravity-parity && npm run verify:errorsamples && npm run verify:e2e-gemini-followup-sample'


> routecodex@0.89.1686 prebuild
> npm run verify:repo-sanity && echo skip-lint


> routecodex@0.89.1686 verify:repo-sanity
> node scripts/ci/repo-sanity.mjs + global install.\n
notes:

title: bug(token-daemon): qwen refresh failure must be non-blocking + non-noisy
description:
## Problem
Qwen refresh_token invalid triggers auto-refresh failure logs during server runtime. Even though it is background, it should never be perceived as blocking or stopping the server, and it should not spam 'Auto-refresh failed...' after we already mark token as permanently invalid.

## Acceptance Criteria
- On permanent refresh failure (invalid_request refresh token/client_id etc), token-daemon auto-suspends and does not emit loud error logs each tick.
- Server traffic and provider requests remain unaffected (no blocking).
- Keep existing behavior: reauth is triggered only by real requests / explicit commands.
- Add/adjust tests as needed.
notes:
Evidence
- TokenDaemon suppresses loud error logs on permanent refresh failure / user timeout; auto-suspend still applies: src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts

Tests
- npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/token-daemon/token-daemon.auto-refresh-noninteractive.spec.ts â†’ PASS
close_reason: Suppress permanent refresh failure spam; auto-suspend token; non-blocking

description:
Problem
- Qwen token refresh returns invalid_request (Invalid refresh token or client_id) and causes repeated auth attempts/log spam during server start/build.
- tokenFile resolution differs across subsystems (daemon/auth repair), making behavior inconsistent.

Acceptance Criteria
- Qwen refresh permanent failure never blocks server startup or request routing.
- Background refresh does not repeatedly print "Auto-refresh failed" or trigger interactive OAuth.
- Interactive OAuth repair is rate-limited (>=30min cooldown) per provider+tokenFile.
- Qwen tokenFile="default" consistently resolves to ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-1-default.json when present.
- Documentation updated (docs/OAUTH.md referenced from README).

Evidence
- Commands: npm run build:dev; npm run install:global
- Logs show no repeated qwen auth popup during build; no fatal errors.
notes:
- Evidence
  - Commit: 5f97027b7
  - Verified: `npm run build:dev` (includes `npm run install:global`) succeeded on 2026-02-04
  - Files: src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts, src/providers/auth/oauth-repair-cooldown.ts, src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts, docs/OAUTH.md

- Result
  - Qwen tokenFile="default" now consistently resolves to ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-1-default.json when present.
  - Interactive OAuth repair cooldown default set to 30m to prevent repeated reauth loops.
  - Token daemon suppresses permanent refresh failure spam and best-effort marks token file as noRefresh to stop repeated retries.

title: WebUI OAuth: authorize å¿…é¡»æ‹‰èµ· Camoufox autoï¼Œä¸” norefresh ä¸èƒ½å¯¼è‡´ no-op
description:
Problem
- WebUI /daemon/oauth/authorize returns OK but does not open Camoufox / does nothing for qwen and antigravity.
- Root cause: token files can be marked norefresh/noRefresh (e.g. Qwen refresh permanent failure) and ensureValidOAuthToken currently skips *all* refresh/reauth when norefresh is set, even for explicit user-triggered authorization.
- Also, daemon-admin authorize does not set provider-specific Camoufox auto mode (qwen/antigravity/gemini).

Acceptance Criteria
- /daemon/oauth/authorize with openBrowser=true always launches Camoufox (not system browser) with provider-specific auto mode; auto fails -> headed manual assist.
- norefresh/noRefresh only disables background auto-refresh; it must NOT prevent explicit authorize (forceReauthorize/openBrowser).
- Verified via unit tests + npm run build:dev (includes install:global).

Evidence
- Repro: WebUI Auth Provider Pool â†’ Authorize OAuth (qwen default / antigravity alias) should actually open Camoufox.
- Commands: npm run build:dev
notes:
Evidence
- WebUI authorize now uses Camoufox-only flow + install hint: src/server/runtime/http-server/daemon-admin/credentials-handler.ts
- Camoufox availability check (no auto-install for WebUI): src/providers/core/config/camoufox-launcher.ts
- Explicit authorize bypasses throttle + norefresh no longer blocks explicit openBrowser/forceReauthorize: src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts
- Camoufox strict mode (no fallback to system browser when ROUTECODEX_OAUTH_BROWSER=camoufox): src/providers/core/config/oauth-flows.ts
- Token refresh daemon uses Camoufox auto for qwen refreshâ†’reauth path: src/token-daemon/token-daemon.ts
- Default server refreshAhead=30min: src/manager/modules/token/index.ts
- Docs: docs/OAUTH.md
- Tests:
  - npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.norefresh-explicit-authorize.spec.ts â†’ PASS
  - npm run test:routing-instructions â†’ PASS
- Full verification: npm run build:dev â†’ PASS (includes install:global) on 2026-02-04
close_reason: Fix WebUI OAuth no-op; enforce Camoufox auto and explicit authorize semantics

title: bug(oauth/webui): verify-required open must use Camoufox
description:
## Problem
- daemon-admin Auth Provider Pool shows antigravity token status "verify required" with an "open" link that opens in the system browser, not Camoufox.
- For manual CLI refresh (routecodex oauth ...), Camoufox automation can run headless and looks like a hang while waiting for localhost callback.

## Acceptance Criteria
- In daemon-admin credentials table, "open" triggers Camoufox (stable profile+fingerprint) instead of system browser.
- If Camoufox is missing, return actionable error (camoufox_missing).
- CLI interactive OAuth refresh defaults to headed Camoufox so users can complete login/2FA/verification.
- Verified via npm run build:dev (includes install:global).

- npm run build:dev â†’ PASS (includes install:global) on 2026-02-04
close_reason: Use Camoufox for verify-required open + make CLI refresh visible

title: bug(antigravity): 403 needs-auth rotate alias + 30m cooldown
description:
When an Antigravity account returns HTTP 403 indicating OAuth is missing/expired (NOT Google account verification gating), routing should immediately switch to another alias and prevent the failing alias from being scheduled for 30 minutes.

Motivation: avoid repeated 403 hammering and unblock queue.
acceptance_criteria:
- On ProviderErrorEvent(status=403, needs-auth), all providerKeys under the same antigravity alias are set out-of-pool with cooldownUntil >= now+30m.
- In a single request retry loop, the failing antigravity providerKey is excluded so router can pick another alias (do not set antigravityAvoidAllOnRetry).
- Existing 403 google verification flow unchanged.
- Regression tests cover both quota daemon + request executor behavior.
notes:
Implemented Antigravity 403 (OAuth reauth-required) handling.

Evidence:
- Quota daemon now cools down entire alias for 30min on needs-auth 403 (not Google verify).
  Files: src/manager/modules/quota/provider-quota-daemon.events.ts
  Test: tests/manager/quota/provider-quota-daemon-module.spec.ts ("cools down an antigravity alias for 30m on OAuth reauth-required 403")
- Request executor now treats Antigravity 403 auth errors as retryable and excludes failing providerKey so router can pick another alias.
  Files: src/server/runtime/http-server/request-executor.ts
  Test: tests/server/runtime/http-server/request-executor.spec.ts ("rotates antigravity alias on 403 OAuth reauth-required error")

Verification:
- npm run test:routing-instructions (passed)
- npm run test:cli (passed)
- npm run build:dev (passed; includes install:global + blackbox antigravity parity)
close_reason: antigravity needs-auth 403 rotates + 30m cooldown

title: bug(quota): network/fetch errors should not backoff-loop
description:
## Problem
- Network/transport failures (e.g. "fetch failed") can cause repeated short backoffs and do not remove the provider from the pool long enough, leading to request storms and session aborts.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Repeated network/fetch errors within the error-chain window escalate cooldown monotonically (no wrap/cycle).
- If error code is missing but message indicates network failure, it is classified as network for quota tracking.
- Cooldown removes providerKey from pool; after TTL expiry it can recover.
- Verified by unit tests and `npm run build:dev` + `npm run install:global`.
notes:
Evidence:
- Commit: 393b7da18
- Unit tests: npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/manager/quota/provider-quota-center.spec.ts tests/manager/quota/provider-quota-daemon-module.spec.ts (PASS)
- Full verify: npm run build:dev (PASS, includes install:global)

Changes:
- provider-quota-center: clamp consecutive count (no wrap)
- quota daemon: pass error message into quota event; classify message-only fetch errors as ENET
- model backoff: clamp capacity schedule (no 9/15/27 loop)
- antigravity 403 reauth: rotate alias + 30m cooldown

title: bug(oauth): interactive OAuth does not open Camoufox window
description:
## Problem
- Running `routecodex oauth <token-file> --force` or `routecodex oauth gemini-auto|antigravity-auto <token-file>` sometimes prints portal/callback instructions but no browser window appears, leaving users stuck.

## Expected
- Interactive/manual OAuth always opens a visible Camoufox window by default (headed), so users can complete login/2FA/verification.
- Auto OAuth may run headless, but must fall back to headed manual assist when automation cannot proceed.

## Acceptance Criteria
- With `ROUTECODEX_CAMOUFOX_DEV_MODE=1` (CLI interactive refresh sets this automatically), Camoufox launcher opens a headed window reliably for manual completion (no silent no-op).
- `npm run build:dev` + `npm run install:global` pass.
notes:
Evidence:
- Commit: 89ed3019f
- Tests: npm run jest:run -- --runTestsByPath tests/cli/start-command.spec.ts tests/cli/camoufox-command.spec.ts tests/token-daemon/interactive-refresh.spec.ts (PASS)
- Full verify: npm run build:dev (PASS, includes install:global)

Change summary:
- scripts/camoufox/launch-auth.mjs: when devMode=true and no autoMode, use Playwright headed manual-assist so a visible window always appears. Fallback to direct binary launch if Playwright is unavailable.
- src/providers/core/config/oauth-flows.ts: print "[OAuth] Launching Camoufox" before opening.

title: feat(oauth): add --headful + clarify callback wait
description: Add a --headful flag to oauth commands to force headed Camoufox, and improve the callback waiting logs so users understand why it is waiting and what to do when no browser window opens.

  File: src/token-daemon/index.ts

Tests:

title: LM Studio: fix streaming decode + terminated SSE
description:
## Problem
LM Studio/OpenAI-compatible upstreams can (a) terminate SSE after tool_call output_item.done or (b) return JSON even when stream=true while the provider wrapper still exposes __sse_stream. Both cases currently surface as SSE_TO_JSON_ERROR: terminated / SSE_DECODE_ERROR and break Codex flows.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Responses SSE: if undici throws terminated after a completed output item, llmswitch-core returns a valid response JSON (no 5xx).
- resp_inbound_stage1_sse_decode: if __sse_stream body starts with JSON, parse JSON and continue (treat as non-SSE).
- Add regressions to sharedmodule matrix for both cases.
- routecodex build:dev passes (includes install:global).
notes:
Evidence (2026-02-05):
- Sharedmodule fix (llmswitch-core):
  - Handle undici "terminated" during Responses SSE aggregation by salvaging completed output items: sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/src/sse/sse-to-json/responses-sse-to-json-converter.ts
  - If provider wrapper exposes __sse_stream but body is JSON, parse JSON and continue: sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/src/conversion/hub/pipeline/stages/resp_inbound/resp_inbound_stage1_sse_decode/index.ts
  - Regressions wired into matrix:
    - sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/scripts/tests/responses-sse-to-json-terminated-salvage.mjs
    - sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/scripts/tests/chat-sse-to-json-openai-no-event.mjs
    - sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/scripts/tests/run-matrix-ci.mjs
- RouteCodex timeout wiring:
  - runtime.transport timeoutMs/maxRetries mapped into provider HTTP config: src/providers/core/api/provider-types.ts, src/server/runtime/http-server/index.ts, src/providers/core/runtime/provider-factory.ts
  - Test: tests/provider/provider-factory.test.ts

Verification:
- sharedmodule matrix: GEMINI_API_KEY= LLMSWITCH_MATRIX_BUILD_SCRIPT=build:ci node scripts/tests/run-matrix-ci.mjs (passed; report saved under sharedmodule/test-results/llmswitch-core/)
- routecodex: npm run build:dev (passed; includes install:global e2e)
close_reason: LM Studio SSE termination + JSON-bodied stream compatibility fixed; verified via sharedmodule matrix + routecodex build:dev

title: Fix Responses tool-call id style leakage (LMStudioâ†’OpenAI)
description:
## Problem
Routing from a Responses-compatible upstream that uses `call_*` tool ids (e.g. LM Studio) into a standard OpenAI `/v1/responses` provider (tab/crs) can leak `toolCallIdStyle=preserve` across followups (e.g. `:stop_followup`). OpenAI rejects non-`fc_*` ids with HTTP 400.

## Acceptance Criteria
- When target provider is standard OpenAI `/v1/responses` (tab/crs), outbound request `input[].id` / `call_id` for `function_call` items is normalized to `fc_*`, and OpenAI no longer returns `Expected an ID that begins with 'fc'`.
- When target provider is LM Studio, `call_*` tool ids are preserved; `call_id`/`tool_call_id`/`id` fields are mirrored so tool loops remain stable.
- Antigravity (Claude via Gemini) no longer fails on `tool_use.id` invalid pattern when tool ids contain non `[A-Za-z0-9_-]` characters.
notes:
## Evidence
- sharedmodule/llmswitch-core: `env -u GEMINI_API_KEY npm run test:matrix` â†’ âœ… Matrix passed (2026-02-05).
- routecodex: `npm run build:dev` â†’ âœ… completed incl. `install:global` + `test:blackbox-antigravity-parity` (2026-02-05).

## Fix Summary
- Route-selected Responses providers now default tool call id style to `fc` (OpenAI) and `preserve` only for LM Studio (`chat:lmstudio` or providerId=lmstudio).
- LM Studio compat normalizes/mirrors `call_id`/`tool_call_id`/`id` fields without rewriting ids.
- Antigravity (Claude via Gemini) sanitizes tool call ids to `[A-Za-z0-9_-]` when injecting `functionCall.id`/`functionResponse.id`.
close_reason: Fixed in sharedmodule/llmswitch-core + verified via matrix + routecodex build:dev

title: iFlow tool calls emitted as Qwen tokens are treated as text
description:
## Symptom
When routing `/v1/responses` to iFlow (providerFamily=iflow, protocol=openai-chat), the model may emit Qwen-style tool tokens in plain text, e.g.:

- `<|tool_call_begin|> functions.exec_command:66 <|tool_call_argument_begin|> {...} <|tool_call_end|>`

These are currently returned to the client as plain text, so tool execution does not happen.

## Expected
Those token blocks should be harvested into structured `choices[].message.tool_calls` so Hub Pipeline can run the tool loop.

## Fix
- Add compat response action for `chat:iflow` that harvests tool calls from assistant text.
- Extend text markup normalizer to parse Qwen token tool blocks.

## Acceptance Criteria
- `chat:iflow` response converts Qwen token markup into `tool_calls` and sets `finish_reason=tool_calls`.
- Matrix includes a deterministic regression test.
notes:
## Evidence
- sharedmodule/llmswitch-core: `env -u GEMINI_API_KEY npm run test:matrix` â†’ âœ… Matrix passed (2026-02-05).
- Added regression: `llmswitch-core/scripts/tests/compat-iflow-qwen-tool-tokens.mjs`.

## Patch Points
- `sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/src/conversion/shared/text-markup-normalizer.ts` (parse `<|tool_call_begin|>` tokens)
- `sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/src/conversion/compat/profiles/chat-iflow.json` (enable `harvest_tool_calls_from_text`)
- `sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/src/conversion/hub/pipeline/compat/compat-*.ts` (new action wiring)
close_reason: Compat updated to harvest Qwen token tool calls for iFlow

title: iFlow: JSON text body causes MALFORMED_RESPONSE
description:
Problem:
- /v1/responses routed to iflow(openai-chat) can return JSON as plain text (wrong Content-Type), so hub receives a string payload and fails canonicalization:
  ProviderProtocolError: [hub_response] Non-canonical response payload at chat_process.response.entry

Impact:
- Tool loop breaks (tools route), request fails with MALFORMED_RESPONSE.

Fix:
- In llmswitch-core resp_inbound stage1, best-effort parse JSON when providerResponse is a string.
- Also expand Qwen tool-token harvesting to tolerate whitespace/newlines and allow write_stdin {}.
acceptance_criteria:
Acceptance Criteria:
- If providerResponse is a JSON string (chat.completion), hub parses it and continues conversion (no MALFORMED_RESPONSE).
- iFlow Qwen token tool-call markup with whitespace/newlines is harvested into tool_calls.
- Matrix tests pass.
notes:
Evidence:
- Sharedmodule commits:
  - d366b55 fix(iflow): harvest qwen tool tokens with whitespace
  - fd4bd27 fix(hub): parse JSON text provider responses
- llmswitch-core matrix: env -u GEMINI_API_KEY -u GOOGLE_API_KEY npm run test:matrix â†’ PASS
  Report: ../sharedmodule/test-results/llmswitch-core/matrix-ci-1770304963680.json
- routecodex dev build + global install: npm run build:dev â†’ PASS; routecodex --version = 0.89.1711
close_reason: fixed in sharedmodule/llmswitch-core

title: iFlow: unwrap {status,msg,body} envelope unconditionally
description:
## Symptom
/v1/responses routed to iFlow sometimes returns an envelope {status,msg,body,request_id}. Hub sees the envelope as the provider response and throws MALFORMED_RESPONSE at chat_process.response.entry (payloadKeys include status/msg/body/request_id). This also prevents Qwen token tool-call harvesting.

## Expected
Compat profile chat:iflow should unwrap to body before semantic mapping/tool harvesting, even when body is not yet recognized as a known provider response shape.

## Acceptance Criteria
- For payload {status,msg,body,request_id}, compat action returns body (parsed if JSON string) so downstream conversion errors reference body shape, not the envelope.
- If body is an OpenAI-chat completion (object or JSON string), conversion proceeds and tool harvesting can run.
- Deterministic regression test added and matrix passes.
notes:
Evidence (2026-02-06):
- sharedmodule/llmswitch-core: env -u GEMINI_API_KEY -u GOOGLE_API_KEY npm run test:matrix â†’ âœ… Matrix passed
- routecodex: npm run build:dev â†’ âœ… Passed (includes install:global + mock regressions)

Patch points:
- sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/src/conversion/compat/actions/iflow-response-body-unwrap.ts
- sharedmodule/llmswitch-core/scripts/tests/compat-iflow-qwen-tool-tokens.mjs (adds 'body SSE text' case)
close_reason: Unwrap iFlow envelope body + SSE text parse

title: Fix Qwen OAuth token not used (api_key enrichment)
description:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Run `routecodex oauth ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-1-default.json` and complete OAuth.
2. Token file contains `access_token`/`refresh_token` but no `api_key`.
3. Start RouteCodex and route a request to Qwen (e.g. background route `qwen.qwen3-coder-plus`).
4. Observe server still fails auth / appears not to use token.

## Acceptance Criteria
- When Qwen token file is missing `api_key`, RouteCodex backfills it via Qwen user-info endpoint and persists it (without requiring token refresh).
- CLI init provider catalog uses `~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-1-default.json` by default.
- `npm run build:dev` passes (includes `install:global`).
notes:
- Code: src/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.ts (Qwen api_key enrichment)
- Config: src/cli/config/init-provider-catalog.ts (tokenFile now qwen-oauth-1-default.json)
- Test: tests/providers/auth/oauth-lifecycle.qwen-enrich.spec.ts (PASS)
- Commit: 9e9ce8769
- Verification: npm run build:dev (includes install:global) completed successfully on 2026-02-03.
close_reason: Implemented Qwen api_key enrichment + default tokenFile alignment

title: Update README files to reflect current module state
iFlow: visionâ†’Kimi K2.5 inline multimodal + dataurl asset resolve + history trim
description:
## Goal
When request contains images (vision intent), if iFlow Kimi K2.5 is configured, route should prefer Kimi K2.5 inline multimodal (single-pass), resolve image URLs/files to iFlow CLI-compatible data URLs, and avoid persisting large base64 blobs in snapshots/history.

## Requirements
- Routing: image requests should prefer routes that can serve inline multimodal via iFlow Kimi K2.5 (similar to current Responses/Gemini inline-vision preference).
- Payload: for openai-chat outbound to iFlow Kimi K2.5, normalize image blocks to OpenAI-chat image_url parts with url=data:<mime>;base64,... by downloading/reading assets.
- History: large base64 must not pollute hub snapshots/policy observations or stored conversation context (trim/redact).
- Video: decide whether to support video_url blocks; default off unless explicitly enabled.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Deterministic matrix tests cover: local file image â†’ data URL; http(s) image â†’ data URL (mocked); data URL passthrough; trim/redaction for snapshots.
- Vision requests route to iFlow Kimi K2.5 when present in default/thinking targets.
- No provider/host semantic repair; all behavior implemented in llmswitch-core.
notes: Implemented in sharedmodule/llmswitch-core: (1) router prefers iflow.*.kimi-k2.5 for image requests (inline-vision); (2) outbound stage resolves image_url assets (file/http) -> data:*;base64 for iFlow Kimi K2.5; (3) vision_auto servertool skips iflow Kimi; (4) snapshot writer redacts large base64 data URLs. Verification: sharedmodule/llmswitch-core matrix PASS via env -u GEMINI_API_KEY -u GOOGLE_API_KEY LLMSWITCH_MATRIX_BUILD_SCRIPT=build:ci node scripts/tests/run-matrix-ci.mjs (report: /Users/fanzhang/Documents/github/sharedmodule/test-results/llmswitch-core/matrix-ci-1770340771042.json). routecodex mock regressions PASS: npm run mock:regressions (41 samples).

description:
Problem

- OpenAI-compatible clients/providers may require function_call item.id to start with `fc_` (OpenAI strict), otherwise follow-up requests can fail.

Acceptance Criteria
- In openai-responses outbound remap, output[] function_call items have `id` beginning with `fc_` and stable per tool call.
- Existing responses tool_call_id preservation regression extended to assert output item.id format.

title: LMStudio terminated SSE salvage should ignore orphan in_progress function_call
description:
## Problem
LMStudio /v1/responses streams may terminate before response.completed while having extra response.output_item.added function_call items that never receive response.function_call_arguments.done + response.output_item.done.
Current salvage path may still emit those orphan calls as completed tool calls with {} arguments, causing downstream tool precheck failures and repeated Server Error in LMStudio UI.

## Acceptance Criteria
- On terminated salvage, only completed function_call items are emitted to output.
- In-progress orphan function_call items are dropped.

Context: current stop_message_auto followup guard blocks all followup hops, which violates intended behavior (allow same stop_message_flow retrigger with counter termination; only prevent nested cross-flow loops). AC3: add regression tests and pass targeted + build:dev verification.

title: LMStudio anthropic: tool_use/tool_result ordering breaks after outbound post-map
description:
Problem
- For /v1/responses -> anthropic-messages (LMStudio), second tool loop turn can fail with HTTP 400: "Tool result message must immediately follow assistant tool use message".
- Snapshot showed stage6 had assistant tool_calls + tool message, but stage7/provider-request downgraded assistant to empty string and left tool_result, violating Anthropic order rule.

Acceptance Criteria
- AC1: Anthropic outbound payload preserves assistant tool_use block and immediate following user tool_result block for tool loop turns.
- AC2: Outbound post-map must not flatten anthropic payload structured blocks into empty string.
- AC3: Add regression coverage for outbound post-map preservation and update anthropic chat regression sample.
- AC4: Build/matrix and global install verification pass.
notes:
Evidence
- Failing request snapshot: ~/.routecodex/codex-samples/openai-responses/lmstudio.key1.qwen3-coder-next-mlx/req_1770377544769_6a6c190b
- stage6 had assistant tool_calls + tool message; stage7/provider-request had assistant content="" + user tool_result only.

Fix
- llmswitch-core: set anthropic outbound post-map messages source to none so post-map bridge actions do not mutate anthropic payload message blocks.
  File: src/conversion/hub/operation-table/operation-table-runner.ts
- Added regression: scripts/tests/anthropic-outbound-postmap-tool-use-preserve.mjs
- Updated regression sample: test/samples/chat-blackbox/anthropic/chat-to-anthropic.json
- Matrix hook added: scripts/tests/run-matrix-ci.mjs
- Prior mapper fix retained: src/conversion/shared/anthropic-message-utils.ts (commit 2cbc41b)
- routecodex dev global install now links global @jsonstudio/llms to local sharedmodule: scripts/install-global.sh

Verification
- sharedmodule: npm run build:ci && node scripts/tests/chat-to-anthropic-regression.mjs && node scripts/tests/anthropic-outbound-postmap-tool-use-preserve.mjs
- sharedmodule: node scripts/tests/run-matrix-ci.mjs -> PASS (report: /Users/fanzhang/Documents/github/sharedmodule/test-results/llmswitch-core/matrix-ci-1770378146315.json)
- routecodex: npm run install:global -> PASS, global llms version shown as 0.6.1726

title: responses: empty completed reply should fallback and include tool list
description:
Context: /v1/responses via crs/openai-responses sometimes returns status=completed with empty assistant output_text and no tool_calls after tool loop turn, causing conversation break. Need fallback behavior similar to gemini empty-reply handling.

Acceptance Criteria:
AC1: when openai-responses upstream payload is completed but assistant output is effectively empty and there are tools configured, output is normalized to a recoverable response shape instead of silent empty stop.
AC2: fallback response contains explicit tool availability list so client/model can continue tool flow.
AC3: finish reason/status handling stays consistent (no false tool_calls when none returned).
AC4: add targeted regression script + matrix hook and pass build matrix.

description:
Symptoms: provider iflow(openai-chat, kimi-k2.5) returns HTTP 400 with message: thinking is enabled but reasoning_content is missing in assistant tool call message at index N. Need single-point compat fix in llmswitch-core so assistant tool_call messages satisfy upstream thinking contract without affecting non-iflow providers.

title: release note: iflow reasoning_content compat fix
description:
Prepare a concise release note for the iflow kimi reasoning_content 400 fix and track it in bd.

Acceptance Criteria:
AC1: Include symptom, root cause, single implementation point, and non-hack scope.
AC2: Include regression coverage (new replay fixture/script + matrix hook).
AC3: Include validation evidence and commit references (routecodex + sharedmodule).
AC4: Close issue with published note text in bd notes.
notes:
Release Note (2026-02-06)

Title
- iflow/kimi tool_call reasoning_content compatibility hardening (responsesâ†’chat path)

What was fixed
- Symptom: iflow kimi-k2.5 requests intermittently failed with HTTP 400: "thinking is enabled but reasoning_content is missing in assistant tool call message".
- Root cause: on responsesâ†’chat bridge path, top-level thinking may be absent, but upstream Kimi still enforces reasoning_content on assistant tool_call messages. Previous logic only injected when thinking was explicitly enabled.

Single implementation point
- llmswitch-core compat action (no virtual-router/provider transport hacks):
  - src/conversion/compat/actions/iflow-kimi-thinking-reasoning-fill.ts
- Behavior now: for kimi-k2.5, fill assistant.tool_call reasoning_content by default; skip only when thinking is explicitly disabled (false/off/disabled).

Regression coverage
- Added replay fixture + script for this sample family:
  - tests/fixtures/compat/iflow-reasoning-missing-sample-20260206.json
  - scripts/tests/compat-iflow-reasoning-replay-20260206.mjs
- Enhanced targeted compat regressions:
  - scripts/tests/compat-iflow-thinking-reasoning-content.mjs
  - scripts/tests/compat-profile-auto-resolve.mjs
- Hooked into matrix:
  - scripts/tests/run-matrix-ci.mjs

Evidence
- Failing sample request lineage: openai-responses-unknown-unknown-20260206T214322604-018
- Replay outcome: missing reasoning_content before > 0; after iflow compat = 0; control provider unchanged.
- Verification passed:
  - sharedmodule: npm run build
  - sharedmodule: compat replay + compat regressions
  - routecodex: npm run build && npm run install:global

Commits
- sharedmodule/llmswitch-core: 06ea3e2
- routecodex (bd record): 807cc440c

RouteCodex bd release-note commit: 3ad3c2c76 (pushed to origin/main).

title: stop_message followup to iflow hits repeated 514 model error
description:
Observed: stop_message_flow followup requests to iflow(kimi-k2.5/openai-chat) frequently fail with iFlow business error 514 (model error), especially with long conversation history.

Acceptance Criteria:
AC1: locate single canonical stage where followup payload size/history is controlled (no virtual router/provider hacks).
AC2: for stop_message_flow followup, trim OpenAI-style history before append stop message, preserving tool adjacency/user anchor semantics.
AC3: make trim threshold configurable by parameter/env with safe default.
AC4: add targeted regression proving followup payload is trimmed and preserves stop_message append behavior.
AC5: run sharedmodule build matrix + host build:dev and record replay/control evidence in bd notes.
notes:
2026-02-07 verification/evidence:
1) Single-point fix lives in llmswitch-core servertool stop_message handler (no provider/router hacks): src/servertool/handlers/stop-message-auto.ts.
2) Followup trim is configurable via env ROUTECODEX_STOPMESSAGE_FOLLOWUP_MAX_NON_SYSTEM_MESSAGES; safe default tightened to 12.
3) Regression: scripts/tests/stop-message-followup-iflow-trim.mjs + matrix hook in scripts/tests/run-matrix-ci.mjs.
4) Build/test: sharedmodule npm run build passed (matrix includes [matrix:stop-message-followup-iflow-trim] ok). routecodex npm run build:dev passed, including install:global, mock regressions, blackbox parity, verify:apply-patch, verify:exec-command.
5) Replay evidence (same-shape/control):
   - same-shape replay against running routecodex using captured __raw_request_body from sample openai-responses-iflow.1-186.kimi-k2.5-kimi-k2.5-20260207T100636992-003_stop_followup returned status=200 (saved /tmp/replay-iflow-same-shape.json).
   - control replay returned status=200 (saved /tmp/replay-control-unaffected.json).
6) Sample trend check under ~/.routecodex/codex-samples/openai-responses/*iflow* shows newer stop_followup requests reduced from ~400KB/230 msgs to ~170KB/52 msgs after trim logic, with successful followups observed.
7) Note: remaining iFlow 514s also appear on non-stop-followup base requests with very large histories (>500KB), which is adjacent but outside this stop_message-only issue scope.

## Suspected Root Cause
- daemon-admin / oauth-lifecycle æ”¯æŒ tokenFile=aliasï¼ˆä¾‹å¦‚ defaultï¼‰ï¼Œä¼šå†™å…¥ ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-<seq>-<alias>.json
- TokenFileAuthProvider å°† tokenFile=alias å½“ä½œè·¯å¾„å¤„ç†ï¼Œä¸”æ—  tokenFile æ—¶é»˜è®¤åªæ‰¾ ~/.routecodex/tokens/qwen-default.jsonï¼Œå¯¼è‡´æ‰¾ä¸åˆ°åˆšå†™å…¥çš„ auth ç›®å½• token

## Acceptance Criteria
- TokenFileAuthProvider æ”¯æŒ tokenFile=aliasï¼ˆä¸ oauth-lifecycle ä¸€è‡´ï¼‰ï¼Œå¯è¯»å– ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-<seq>-<alias>.jsonï¼ˆä¼˜å…ˆæœ€æ–° seqï¼‰
- TokenFileAuthProvider æ—  tokenFile æ—¶ï¼Œä¼˜å…ˆè¯»å– ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth.json åŠ auth ç›®å½•ä¸‹ qwen-oauth-*.jsonï¼ˆå…¼å®¹ daemon oauth æˆæƒï¼‰

notes:
Root cause confirmed: daemon-admin/oauth-lifecycle persists Qwen OAuth tokens under ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth-<seq>-<alias>.json (or alias-based), but TokenFileAuthProvider treated tokenFile=alias as a path and (when tokenFile missing) only searched ~/.routecodex/tokens/qwen-default.json / ~/.cli-proxy-api, so it never found the saved token.

Fix:
- TokenFileAuthProvider now supports tokenFile=alias (no / and no .json) -> resolves to latest seq file in auth dir for that alias.
- For qwen, if tokenFile points to legacy ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth.json but file missing, fall back to latest qwen-oauth-*.json.
- For qwen with no tokenFile, prefer ~/.routecodex/auth/qwen-oauth.json then latest qwen-oauth-*.json.

Evidence:

- dist sanity: node -e "import { TokenFileAuthProvider } from "./dist/providers/auth/tokenfile-auth.js"; ..." now shows isValid=true for tokenFile=default and builds Authorization header.
